intro: Sonchus congestus, commonly known as the clustered sowthistle, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are broadly triangular and hairy. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early autumn, producing yellow flowers that attract pollinators. It is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in cultivated fields.
